attributes.action: Put additional stamp duty on international buyers
attributes.background: Foreign buyers have driven the demands of our properties. This is making properties prices higher and higher. This needs to be controlled. A lots of properties that foreign buyers own remain empty as well.

attributes.action: Include under 25s in the National Living Wage & adopt the real living wage.
attributes.background:
The Govt's National Living Wage is currently set at £7.50/hr for people aged 25 & over. However this doesn't apply to under 25s, some of whom can be on wages as low as £5.60/hr. We call on the Govt to:
- Include under 25s
- Adopt the real living wage (£10.20 in London, £8.75 in the rest of the UK)
attributes.additional_details: As the Living Wage Week comes to end, we believe that workers in Britain deserve a proper wage rise. With the Chancellor preparing to announce his first budget of this Parliament, we must put pressure on the Govt to adopt the real living wage released by the Living Wage Foundation. A report released by KPMG highlighted that 5.5 million people still earn less than the real Living Wage rates. If you believe that all workers deserve a fair day’s pay for a fair day’s work, please sign this petition.

attributes.action: Make all nightclubs and pubs charge the same price entry for men and women
attributes.background: With all the recent outrage about gender equality and the unfair treatment of women, I would like to highlight an issue which I feel should have been changed by now considering it is illegal to discriminate against someone because of gender: Nightclubs in the UK charge men more for entry.
attributes.additional_details: This is unfair and there is no logical explanation behind it.

attributes.action: Stop paying wealthy pensioners the  tax-free winter fuel payment.
attributes.background: Our country needs to stop giving away  money to those who don't need it. The revenue from not paying EVERY pensioner the tax free money can better be used to help th struggling health system.

attributes.action: To implement a fishery licence to shoot a maximum of 3 otters a year.
attributes.background:
The current growth rate and lack of food for the otter has ment many well stocked fisheries to now be under attack. 
The otter while understandably protected, has outgrown its surroundings and is now ruining livelihoods of a multi billion pound industry.
attributes.additional_details:
There is so many videos of otter damage to fish, birds and wild life something has to be done to protect, 
1. Fish stocks in rivers
2. Bird life on nature reserves and rivers 
3. Fishery livelihoods. 
The continuing release of otters since 1999 has grown.
Earsham 2006 149 otters released 
And many more have been released under the radar.  
Many expensive carp have fallen victim to the otter and has cost many fisheries thousands of pounds in otter fencing where allowed and replacement of fish.

attributes.action: Ensure vics of CSA under UK est care get full legal redress like NSW & Victoria
attributes.background: With IICSA currently investigating the full extent of CSA in the UK, we the undersigned believe that all councils and establishments under whose care such occurs should by law provide full legal redress.
attributes.additional_details: We require Parliament to pass an Act to make it possible as is the case in NSW and Victoria, Australia for victims of child sex abuse to be permitted full legal redress automatically.

attributes.action: Removal of the traffic calming on the Northway Lane M5 flyover
attributes.background: Nearly every day there’s a near miss on the M5 Northway Lane bridge because of the traffic calming measures as people either ignore the give way and going too fast! People also can’t see over the brow! The local road safety team don’t want to know about the state of the counties roads or anything

attributes.action: Ensure that the U.K. leaves the EU Single Market & Customs Union.
attributes.background: On 23rd June 2016, the U.K. voted by majority to leave the EU. In the 2017 General Election, the two main parties promised to leave the single market & customs union and subsequently they received an 80% vote share. Therefore the government must be able to withdraw the U.K. from the Customs Union.
attributes.additional_details: If certain MP’s & political parties continue to frustrate Brexit then they will be rejecting the will of the people. When voters voted for Brexit, they voted to control Britain’s borders; control our laws and have the ability to strike free trade deals around the world. The government must be allowed to deliver upon the wishes of the people.

attributes.action: Permit all public universities to test cannabis for medical use
attributes.background: Cannabis is widely believed to have broad medical applications, and there is solid evidence to support some of these. We cannot know the true extent without research. It seems obvious that the current restriction is based on ideology rather than evidence, and this stance is academically unacceptable
attributes.additional_details: Cannabis has been shown to improve the endurance of cancer patients and to improve the experiences of those with chronic pain.  Cannabis has also been shown to be minimally addictive and minimally harmful to health, whilst the debate over its social detriments has contained more heat than light.  The way to put this to bed, one way or the other, is to let the academics test it and find out exactly what it does.  We permit tests on other classes of drugs including opiates, why not cannabis?

attributes.action: Compulsory to not repay any Tax Credits overpayments until it's been disputed
attributes.background: So many people receive letters from tax credits about overpayments that have to be paid back before it can be disputed. We need to make it compulsory that all evidence and appeals are done before any repayments have to be set up.
attributes.additional_details: I personally have been in this situation and from speaking to a number of people that have also experienced this, it would seem that once tax credits have received repayments or some form of monthly repayment method then they are no longer interested at looking at any evidence to dispute an overpayment. Therefore people are left with debts that are incorrect and have to pay them all back because they don't think they have any other option.

attributes.action: Strip the £32m funding from Oxfam & share to the rest of the charities in the UK
attributes.background: There is 185000 Charities registered in the UK and the vast the majority rely on meagre amounts compared to this £32m to teach Oxfam a lesson who already make £90m a year from it's shops, this could significantly help the smaller independent charities up and down the entire country
attributes.additional_details: There are more than 185,000 registered charities in England and Wales. The number is rising by 5,000 a year. As you read this, another charity will be created somewhere in the country. The charity commission lists 620 cancer charities alone and more than 200 charities working with homeless people just in London. - The Guardian

attributes.action: Egg freezing free on the NHS for Fibroid Carriers.
attributes.background: 1 in 5 women over the age of 30 suffer Fibroids with the most common being in African American women. Most women with fibroids will not be infertile, but depending on the severity of the Fibroids, some women are left with a number of symptoms from sever periods and heavy bleeding to Hysterectomy.
attributes.additional_details: Pregnant in 2016, at first scan was i told i was suffering from Fibroids. This made pregnancy hard, leaving me with severe cramps and bleeding. Had no choice but to have a planned c section. 7 months after, i was hospitalized due to sever bleeding and dizziness, cramps and pain from the fibroids. 27 and ive had to start early menopause injections because of the bleeding and pain and told no choice but to have hysterectomy. NHS provides egg freezing for transgender but not for Fibroid sufferers.

attributes.action: To also be seen as a breach of contact when a father doesn’t show up to contact
attributes.background: I have a child arrangement order in place with my ex partner which states I have to make my child  available for contact if I do not I am breaching the court order and can be fined or even imprisoned yet if he doesnt show the court don’t see that as a breach
attributes.additional_details: I feel it is only fair that if the court orders things in a child arrangement order and it must be abided by law by myself then also my ex partner should be treated the same in the event of repeatedly not bothering to show up especially with no explanation. I feel it is only fair in this day and age that both parties in the situation be treated/punished equally in the event of breaking contact which has been ordered by the court.

attributes.action: Scrap school league tables to reduce pressures on young people and teachers
attributes.background: At the root cause of mental health difficulties in young people are league tables. There is pressure on students and staff to succeed as they are judged on exam performance data. Students with special educational needs flounder or move from mainstream schools which are struggling to be inclusive.
attributes.additional_details:
The government recognises the need to transform the mental health provision for children and young people (Green paper, Dec 2017). Whilst the proposals are welcomed, it would make sense to address the underlying causes. 
The Guardian stated that exclusions are increasing partly because schools are under pressure to compete in league tables and exam results. Disruptive,vulnerable pupils who are likely to lower overall GCSE performance are weeded out before their national tests (Oct 2017).

attributes.action: Ensure HMI inspectors inspecting SEN schools have sufficient experience in SEN
attributes.background: From both personal experience and talks with others educational professionals, the majority of OFSTED inspectors who grade special schools have insufficient knowledge of SEN or more shockingly, none.

attributes.action: Make prostitution legal in order to make sex workers safe and keep them healthy.
attributes.background: For our citizenship GCSE qualification, we must choose an issue that we believe needs attention, and should be discussed as many people are being affected by the stigma on sex workers.This affects their health and safety as they are scared to be tested for STIs or report cases such as rape or abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Before creating this petition, we did research on both the advantages and disadvantages of legalizing prostitution and how it would affect people. We also conducted primary research and gave out a questionnaire in school asking teachers their opinion on the issue and explaining how people, especially sex workers, would benefit if it were legal. 61% of the teachers agreed that it should be legalized before we told them the advantages and disadvantages, and 75% agreed after learning the benefits.

attributes.action: Make sure that development of new drugs is not adversely affected by BREXIT.
attributes.background: The Government must commit to following the current process for all drugs already in the EU clinical trial and approval pipeline.
attributes.additional_details:
Doctors and drug companies work in many countries to develop a drug.  Drugs in development now will be in Clinical Trial both before and after March 2019.

Bodies like the European Medicines Agency regulate drug approval with a single set of regulations and approval steps. 

Developing effective treatments for debilitating diseases will greatly reduce the long-term financial and social cost to the UK.

https://www.ft.com/content/e3e9ac6a-5f2d-11e7-8814-0ac7eb84e5f1

attributes.action: Legislate to ban fast food delivery riders from working without a full license.
attributes.background: Fast food delivery riders are under pressure to deliver as soon as possible, in some cases they have a set time, or lose money.  They can get on a moped with no training or experience.  All that is required is a provisional licence and a set of ‘l plates’.
attributes.additional_details: Riders can be seen throughout the UK weaving  and zigzagging through traffic, overtaking and squeezing through almost impossible spaces, in a kamikaze like attempt to deliver and get back to base and be on the road again. This gets worse when other delivery riders are near.  Intense rivalry between companies and even colleagues makes for dangerous situations.

attributes.action: Clothing shops to have full disabled access and disabled changing facilities
attributes.background: Many stores in the UK don’t have disabiled access and unsutiable changing facilities for people with disabilities. I would like the government to introduce legislation that would make it compulsory for all clothing stores to have disabled changing facilities.

attributes.action: Allow citizens to raise concerns about M.P.s' behaviour during Commons' Debates
attributes.background: M.P.s may raise a Point of Order during a House of Commons’ sitting if they think that an M.P. has said something offensive or inappropriate during a Commons' Debate.  There is no way for members of the public to do this.
attributes.additional_details: Members of the public should be able to raise a matter of concern with the Speaker, who should be required to report it to the House (as was tradition, such as in the case of the Imprisonment for Default of Mr. S. Saklatvala, M.P., in May 1926).

attributes.action: Put Dropped Kerbs REQUIRED in Law into the Highways Acts, At this time it is Not
attributes.background: A number today just do their own thing on the Highways causing Areas to look Run Down, All Properties that want a Drive ‘Must Have A Dropped Kerb’ and a Tarmac Area to their Boundary, this would keep things in Order and Controlled, some put items in the gutter to get over it, Dangerous to Cyclists.
attributes.additional_details:
Some Property Owners Churn Up the Grass Verges causing issues with Mud Displacement onto Footpaths which the Council has to Clean Up st Cost, if it was Law to have a Dropped Kerb none of these issues would arise, believe anyone doing so can Get Blocked in as there is No drive in Law, if Written into the Highways Acts would clean up the Highways in General, also stop these putting things into the gutters to get over the Kerbs and keep them free from any Obstruction.

Should be common sense.

attributes.action: Allow under 40s to access their pension pot in order to buy their first house.
attributes.background: Young people are struggling to raise the funds to but their first home, yet they can have enough money for a deposit in their pension funds. The simplest solution being that younger people should be able to access their pension funds purely for use as a deposit for their first home.

attributes.action: Start teaching a language thoroughly from the school year of reception (age 4/5)
attributes.background: Teaching a language from primary school level is not yet compulsory at key stage 1, which is a major part of a child’s development. If taught thoroughly from a younger age, the more likely a child is to remember the language, which will also help in their working future.
attributes.additional_details: A DfE representative found that there is no requirement to teach languages in all years in KS2, as long as the content of the programme of study has been covered by the end of KS2. The UK needs a multilingual population in order to succeed in a globalised world, for global citizenship, security and to operate efficiently in trade and investment. The research, commissioned by the British Council, also revealed that UK schoolchildren are now less likely to speak a foreign language than those in any other European nation.

attributes.action: Requesting salary history to be made unlawful in the UK.
attributes.background:
Requesting salary history  as part of job selection process has to be made unlawful in the UK.This has been made a law in New York and other US states. So why not in the UK?

Being underpaid once shouldn't condemn you to a lifetime of inequality.
attributes.additional_details:
- A number of people are underpaid in the UK. Salary history should not be a factor in determining new pay as that undervalues the current market price for the position and skills of the employee.

- There is gender pay gap in the UK, and this will help bridge closing the gap. This is a well known issue in the UK which the government is tackling.

- Jobs will be offered based on skills, merit and demands of the job. Not gender, race or ethnicity.

attributes.action: Remove Parental Responsibility if convicted of paedophilia & domestic violence
attributes.background: Apart from financially supporting their children, people convicted of paedophilia or domestic violence should have no further parental responsibility for them. Both domestically violent people and paedophiles should not be able to utilise courts to continue their control.
attributes.additional_details:
Protect the survivor, protect the children.

The HEAL Foundation asks the Government to rescind parental responsibility from both domestically violent people and paedophiles. If someone is convicted for domestic violence, the judge should rescind their Parental Responsibility rights so the abusive party cannot use the courts to continue their control. Judges should end Parental Responsibility permanently for convicted paedophiles.

attributes.action: Condemn the military action against ethnic Kurds by Iran and Iraq.
attributes.background: After the decision by the people of Kurdistan for independence in a referendum, retaliatory force by the Iranian backed militia and the Iraqi army against Kurdish populations in Kirkuk have resulted in dispossession and ethnically motivated crime.

attributes.action: Abolish the annual Rod Licence for anglers in England and Wales
attributes.background: More than a million freshwater anglers in England and Wales (not Scotland) pay an annual fee for a (fishing) Rod Licence. This is a tax on angling. Yet there is no licence needed to walk the same river, nor to visit our National Parks, nor to climb a mountain or bicycle on our roads.
attributes.additional_details: Income from licences is falling. Between 2010 and 2016 a drop of 12.6%. Income down from £25.4m to £22.2m. Dr. Broughton at the ATA has collated data over the last six years. •You don't need a licence in Scotland or for sea fishing. •It is unfair anglers have to buy a licence to enjoy a legal hobby when no others who make an equal claim on natural resources do •Anglers spend £1.2bn annually; that is £240m in VAT income alone. Abolition is likely to see participation increase

attributes.action: No more speed humps and better sequencing of traffic lights for cleaner air
attributes.background:
Traffic calming measures might be reducing the chance of an accident, but they increase pollution
Cars repeatedly slowing down and speeding up, which almost doubles the amount of harmful gases and particles they emit. Not to mention break dust
Green wave for drivers driving within the speed limit
attributes.additional_details:
It should be a better way to keep the traffic slow and steady.
Cameras could be installed in 20mph zones to keep the cars slow and steady.
It should be speed cameras in front of every school and pedestrian crossing as well.
Traffic lights should be better sequenced as well (green wave) to protect that drivers will keep arriving at green lights rather than red ones if they drive within the speed limit

attributes.action: Free NHS prescriptions for sickle cell anaemia patients
attributes.background: Incurable disease, it is a chronic blood disorder

attributes.action: Make it law that it is reported to the police when a cat is knocked down.
attributes.background: Unlike the current laws regarding dogs, it is NOT required to report the knocking down of a cat. Not only is it unfair, but also cruel. A cat has as much right as a dog, however, they are not given the same kindness and protection of the current laws of our lands.

attributes.action: UK govt to build a ship which can remove and recycle plastic from the oceans
attributes.background:
There are "islands" of plastic in our oceans which are 1- dangerous to marine life;  2- polluting our world; 3- a waste of resources
4- a human problem.
The UK govt could lead the world by building a ship which can collect the plastic, process it and bring to the UK to reuse the plastic
attributes.additional_details:
Ecological - There are millions of tons of resources lying on the ocean, we put it there, we should retrieve it. 

Resource - The technology exists to collect and re-use that plastic resource (think of it like a natural resource which we can mine and exploit). We can build infrastructure projects with free plastic!

Britain was built on a sea-faring heritage. Post-Brexit, this is an opportunity to show that we still lead the world. 

Finally, why would you or any country say "no"?

attributes.action: Make Battle of Britain Day, the 15th of September, a public holiday.
attributes.background: Let the 15th of September as "Battle of Britain Day" be made a public holiday to celebrate that one day in the field of human conflict that represents that grand singularity of the unity of purpose of the diverse peoples of this great nation that says 'together we are'.
attributes.additional_details:
The Battle of Britain, as fought between the 10th of July and the 31st of October, 1940, was summed up by Winston Churchill with the words "Never in the field of human conflict was so much owed by so many to so few". 

On the 15th of September, 1940, the Luftwaffe embarked on its largest bombing attack yet, which required the engagement of the entirety of the RAF in defence of London and the South East, resulting in a decisive British victory that marked the turning point in Britain's favour.

attributes.action: Allow undiagnosed children to travel to different countries to treat & diagnose
attributes.background: If a child's hospital wish to turn off the life support of a child who has an undiagnosed condition, but there is an alternative hospital abroad willing to treat them and find a possible diagnosis, then the parents should legally be allowed to decide if the child should go. Parental rights!!
attributes.additional_details: There have been many documented cases of parents vs a hospital in times of difficult decision making regarding their child's life. Many have been forced to switch off the life support of a child or have legal action taken against them for fighting for their child. If the parents believe their child can have a chance of living if they are treated somewhere else, parents should be allowed to move their child to a different hospital when there is a hospital offering their child a place!

attributes.action: QTS for Indian teachers.
attributes.background: Bachelor of Education degree (B.Ed.) must be recognised as QTS ( Qualified teacher status) in UK. In the same way as teaching degrees from EEA, US, Australia & New Zealand are recognised.
attributes.additional_details: The Indian education system has produced doctors, engineers and qualified professionals, working around the world. Ironic, that our teachers cannot work with their degree in UK, but can vote here!

attributes.action: Make food manufacturers include the potassium content and Phosphate on labels.
attributes.background: People with Heart/Renal problems need to be mindful of the food they are eating making sure they do not consume to much potassium and phosphate, however this information is largely unknown by the manufacture. This petition aims to make the food manufacturers make this information readily available.

attributes.action: Don't ban single use plastic straws for disabled people.
attributes.background: People with no arms or extremely short arms, people paralysed from the neck down, people with severe arthritis,muscle wasting diseases,cerebral palsy, these are just some disabled people who NEED straws to stay hydrated, my list by no means covers every type of impairment where straws are necessary.
attributes.additional_details: Plain and simple, if you cannot use your arms then you NEED a straw. The evidence so far regarding the alternatives to plastic straws is, the biodegradable ones start degrading when you put them in a hot drink as to the wheat ones, glass ones are dangerous for those who may accidentally bite them, bamboo and other wooden types are not flexible enough, some of the alternatives also change the flavour of the drink.

attributes.action: Give students in unaffordable cities larger student loans for unaffordable rent.
attributes.background: Winchester, outside of London is the second most expensive place to live in the UK. House prices have increased by 59% since 2007 but student loans have been cut. Large numbers of students here spent their entire student loans on housing alone and it’s getting more and more unaffordable every year.
attributes.additional_details:
Minimum halls costs are £121 p/w to £146 p/w. 
Private housing costs roughly the same. 
There is a shortage of jobs for students who need to work to afford rent, food and necessities. A number of students work outside of Winchester to secure work. Other students choose to live in surrounding towns and cities for cheaper rent. 

https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/uk-least-affordable-cities-house-prices-london-oxford-a7606326.html

https://www.winchester.ac.uk/accommodation-and-winchester-life/accommodation/costs/ 

https://www.your-move.co.uk/estate-agent/winchester/find-property-for-rent

attributes.action: Commemorate the life of Stephen Hawking with a day of national mourning.
attributes.background:
One of the greatest minds of his generation.
A national treasure.
Influential for years to come.

attributes.action: OFSTED to closely monitor training qualifications provided by care organisations
attributes.background: All care companies should have, their training programmes Ofsted inspected, and assessors to hold the minimum of a teaching degree.
attributes.additional_details: Currently care companies, self regulate their in house training programmes. This leaves their training programmes wide open not only to educational fraud, but also the substandard delivery and assessment of  in-house training programmes. Each in-house training programme should also lead to a nationally recognised qualification. Which should be standardised internally and externally.

attributes.action: Reduce the deadline date of the tampon tax from 2022 to 2019!
attributes.background: The Treasury vowed to axe the outdated tax on all sanitary products in January 2016. Currently, the Tampon Tax is set to be abolished by 2022 at the earliest. Help to put an end to the marginalisation of issues of women by demanding a zero tax rate for sanitary products.
attributes.additional_details:
Women are expected to spend £900 in tax for their periods in their lifetime. Menstruation should not be labelled as a luxury.

Together, with the abolishment of the tampon tax, we can get rid of the taboo around menstruation.

attributes.action: Put pressure on the US government to be stricter in relation to gun usage
attributes.background: On Wednesday 14th February, a shooting took place at a High School in Florida. There are, at the moment, 17 known fatalities and many other casualties. This is not the first occasion in which guns have affected people's safety.

attributes.action: Make the UK Government Condem Turkey's actions against the YPG
attributes.background: The Turkish government has insisted for many years that the YPG, a group based mainly of the Kurdish people, a race historically oppressed by the Turkish government, is a terrorist organisation, going as far to blame them for domestic terrorist events in Turkey without any prior evidence or backing.
attributes.additional_details:
The YPG is already a struggling fighting force, backed by several NATO countries in the fight against the international terrorist organisation Daesh. Unlike the YPG whose policies preach equality, peace and democracy, Daesh present an international danger to any country that supports western ideals of freedom and rights for all. The military might of turkey greatly outweighs that of the YPG, which already faces a difficult and long battle against Daesh, one which is greatly hindered by the targeted smart bombs dropped by Turkish jets, constant artillery barrages and mechanized troops on the Turkish border.
massacres and repression:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_rights_of_Kurdish_people_in_Turkey
Operation 'Olive Branch'
http://www.rudaw.net/english/middleeast/syria/200120181

attributes.action: Stop once and for all unsolicited SMS fraud in the UK
attributes.background: Shady companies are sending fraudulent unsolicited premium rate SMS text messages to mobile phone owners in the UK. These cost recipients up to £4.50 a message often resulting in huge bills to the victim as the fraud is likely to go unnoticed for long periods of time.
attributes.additional_details:
Find a detailed description of the issue here:

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3580058/Thousands-hit-4-50-time-scam-Customers-facing-bills-hundreds-pounds-texts-advertising-gaming-services-pornographic-content.html

This petition posits it should be a legal requirement for phone carriers to:

Not allow these services be activated on a customer’s account unless they have explicitly requested so (e.g. a representative of the carrier calls the customer to confirm activation of this service was indeed requested). If a carrier does not have this framework in place, they should not be allowed to operate premium SMS services at all.

attributes.action: Giving the British people the right to remove members of the Lords by petition.
attributes.background: I want to start this petition because some of the unelected members of the Lords are ignoring the will of the British people and acting in their own interests. There is no participation by the British people in who is appointed to the Lords. In a real democracy there should be a way to remove them .
attributes.additional_details: I help run a large Community Hall and a significant number of the membership when asked about the interference of the Lords into the EU referendum cannot understand why they are not answerable to anyone.

attributes.action: Remove the no smoking ban from mental health hospitals
attributes.background: I recently stayed in a mental health hospital and was unable to smoke. This is almost a form of torture. For 5 days i was unable to go out or go to a smoking area. People have enough stress while in hospital, there should be a smoking area where people can go to at least once an hour

attributes.action: Make online markets such as eBay responsible for issuing a full Vat invoice.
attributes.background: Rarely are proper invoices sent out with purchases made on line, it should be the responsibility of the online market to issue a full invoice with sellers details at time of purchase and it should clearly show before final payment if Vat is being charged

attributes.action: The government must carry out a public inquiry into offshore tax havens.
attributes.background:
The UK wealth gap is widening and child poverty is increasing.  Yet the UK has seen a boom in the number of high-net-worth individuals.

To show commitment for creating a fairer society, the government must start by investigating the use of offshore tax havens.
attributes.additional_details: CEO pay is 129 times that of the average worker.  In 2000 CEOs earned 47 times that of the average worker.  In the 1970s the ratio was much lower.  Meanwhile, UK food bank use continues to rise, schools are underfunded and understaffed, hospitals cannot cope with the number of patients they are receiving and transport services are overpriced.

attributes.action: Prevent purchasers withdrawing from domestic property sales without consequence.
attributes.background: In England purchasers having had an offer accepted by the vendor are at liberty to withdraw from the transaction right up until contracts are exchanged without any cause. When this happens the vendors are usually unable to complete their purchase and left with significant nugatory costs to bear.

attributes.action: Make alcohol activated immobilisers mandatory on all new vehicles
attributes.background:
On average 3,000 people are killed or seriously injured each year in drink drive collisions
One of these was my friend, someone's husband, and about to be a father
If cars, motorbikes and vans were fitted with a breathalyser linked to the immobiliser, not one of these tragedies would have happened
attributes.additional_details:
Just think about what you do when you get in your car - you put your seatbelt on, turn the ignition on and release the handbrake. One small extra step to breathe into a breathalyser before your engine will turn on would be nothing. 
The cost of these units is around £1000, but vehicle (and motorbike) manufacturers could drive that cost right down with bulk orders.
They have been around for years - why are they not an every day part of cars and motorbikes?

attributes.action: hold a new general election in 2018
attributes.background: There needs to be an general election in 2018 because no one has the majority in Westminster
